title: How to Create a Content Calendar with AI
description: Plan a month of social media posts in 30 minutes instead of scrambling daily.
requirements: Google Sheets or a note-taking app

steps.title: Ask ChatGPT to create your calendar
steps.description: Get a full month planned in one prompt.
substeps: Try: 'Create a 4-week social media content calendar for a [your trade] business. Include 3 posts per week. Mix educational tips, before/after showcases, behind-the-scenes, and promotional content. Give me the post topic and a brief description for each.'
steps.tip: Ask for variations: 'Make it more casual' or 'Add seasonal relevance for [month].'

steps.title: Organize in a simple spreadsheet
steps.description: Make it easy to track and execute.
substeps: Create a Google Sheet with columns: Date | Post Type | Topic | Caption | Photo Needed | Posted?
Fill in the dates for the next 4 weeks
Copy ChatGPT's suggestions into the Topic column

steps.title: Generate the actual captions
steps.description: Get ChatGPT to write each post.
substeps: For each topic, ask: 'Write a Facebook/Instagram post about [topic] for my [trade] business. Keep it under 200 words and include a call-to-action.'
Copy each caption into your spreadsheet
Do this in batches — write a week's worth at once

steps.title: Match photos to posts
substeps: Look at each topic — what photo would work?
Use your library of job photos
If you don't have the right photo, add it to your shot list
steps.tip: Take 3-5 photos at every job. You'll always have content.

steps.title: Schedule or post weekly
substeps: Option 1: Schedule posts with Buffer (free) or Meta Business Suite (free)
Option 2: Set a reminder to post each day based on your calendar
Post at consistent times (evenings and weekends often perform well)
Check off each post as you publish it

successMessage: You have a month of content planned! No more 'what should I post today?' stress.
proTips: Batch content creation: Write all posts on Sunday, schedule for the week
Repurpose content: Same post can go on Facebook, Instagram, and Nextdoor
Refresh your calendar monthly — keep seasonal content relevant
